Menands School to Honor Juneteenth
The Menands Union Free School District Board will act to recognize June 19, 2020 and observe Juneteenth. This is the oldest nationally celebrated commemoration of the ending of slavery in the United States. It serves as a reminder of the hardships and losses suffered by African Americans in their struggle to achieve freedom. We believe it is important to commemorate such an important day and history and reflect upon the freedom and civil rights of all Americans. text:
Menands School to Honor Juneteenth
The Menands Union Free School District Board will act to recognize June 19, 2020 and observe Juneteenth. This is the oldest nationally celebrated commemoration of the ending of slavery in the United States. It serves as a reminder of the hardships and losses suffered by African Americans in their struggle to achieve freedom. We believe it is important to commemorate such an important day and history and reflect upon the freedom and civil rights of all Americans. We do so following the example set by the state of New York, our neighboring City of Albany and in conjunction with the Village of Menands.

Are you looking for a way for your student to stay active during spring? Menands' track season will be gearing up with its first practice on April 1 for eligible students in Grades 5-8!

Students must sign up before practice. Mandatory practices begin on Monday, April 1 and the last day to join the team is Thursday, April 4. The season runs through May 23.

Practices will be from 3:03 to 4 p.m. on Monday, Wednesday and Thursday, and will not be canceled due to inclement weather so students should remember to attend practice wearing appropriate attire.

Eligibilty for the team is based on grades and attendance. Any questions, please email Mr. Blanchet at cblanchet@menands.org.
